LogMode.description: Log push. To push migration logs to SLS, you need to create the AliyunOSSImportSlsAuditRole role and grant permissions to the role. Valid values: off, do not push logs; basic, which pushes only file migration failure logs. detail, which pushes the log of file migration success and failure.

MaxQps.description:
Qps throttling of the channel.

Valid values: greater than or equal to 0, the default value is 0, indicating that it is not restricted.

MaxBandwidth.description:
The bandwidth of the channel is limited in bytes/s.

Valid values: no less than 10485760 (10MBps), the default value is 0, indicating that the limit is not limited.

schema.description: The request body for creating the migration task.

ImportJob.description: The details for creating the migration task.

CreateJob.title: CreateJob
CreateJob.description:
*   Before you create a migration task, you must create a data address.
*   A migration task can run multiple rounds. Each round has an execution ID.

GetJob.summary: Obtains the details of a migration task.

schema.description: Specifies whether to obtain the details of the migration task by using the task ID.
The name of the migration task. If the byVersion parameter is set to true, this parameter indicates the ID of the migration task.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

ImportJob.description: The details for obtaining the details of the migration task.

GetJob.title: GetJob

ListJob.summary: Lists the migration tasks created by a user in the specific region.

schema.description:
The marker after which the migration tasks are listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of migration tasks to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000 (excluding 0).\
Default value: 1000.
The name of the parent task. If this parameter is specified, all subtasks of the parent task are returned.

Specifies whether to return subtasks.\
Valid values: true and false.
The response body.

ListJob.title: ListJob

UpdateJob.summary: Updates the status or throttling of a task.

schema.description: The request body for updating the task.

ImportJob.description: The details for updating the task.

schema.description: The task name.

UpdateJob.title: UpdateJob
UpdateJob.description: *   A request can update either the status or throttling of a task.

schema.description: Specifies whether to force delete the subtask. If the task has subtasks and you set this parameter to true, the task and its subtasks are forcibly deleted. If this parameter is set to false, the task and its subtasks fail to be deleted.
The task name.

DeleteJob.title: DeleteJob
DeleteJob.description: *   The operation to delete a migration task is asynchronous. The migration task remains in the Deleting state until it is deleted.

ListJobHistory.summary: Lists the running history of a migration task.

schema.description: The task name.
The execution ID of the task. If you specify an execution ID, only the running history related to the execution ID is listed.

The marker after which the running history of the task is listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of running records of the migration task to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000.\
Default value: 1000.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

JobHistoryList.description: The running history of the migration task.

ListJobHistory.title: ListJobHistory
ListJobHistory.description:
*   A migration task can run multiple times. A unique execution ID is generated for each time.
*   The running history of a migration task records the status change history of the task.

schema.description: The request body for creating the migration report.

CreateReport.description: The details for creating the migration report.

CreateReport.title: CreateReport
CreateReport.description: *   If you specify that a migration report is to be generated when you create a migration task, you do not need to call this operation. If you do not specify that a migration report is to be generated when you create a migration task, you can call this operation to create a migration report for a specific execution ID.

GetReport.summary: Obtains the details of a migration report.

schema.description: The ID of the migration task.
The execution ID of the migration task.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

GetReportResponse.description: The details for obtaining the migration report.

GetReport.title: GetReport
GetReport.description: *   The migration report is pushed to your destination data address. For more information, see [View a migration report](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/data-online-migration/user-guide/manage-migration-jobs-between-oss-buckets).

GetJobResult.summary: Obtains the list of files that fail to be migrated when files fail to be migrated during a migration task.

schema.description: The task name.
The execution ID of the task.
The response body.

ImportJobResult.description: The details for obtaining the retries of the migration task.

GetJobResult.title: GetJobResult
GetJobResult.description: *   When files fail to be migrated during a migration task, a list of files that fail to be migrated is generated. You can call this operation to obtain the list of such files. You can create a data address based on this list and create a subtask. This way, you can migrate these files that fail to be migrated again.

schema.description: The request body for creating the data address.

ImportAddress.description: The details for creating the data address.

CreateAddress.title: CreateAddress
CreateAddress.description: *   If you want to use an agent to migrate data, you must create an agent first and then associate the agent when you create a data address.

GetAddress.summary: Obtains the details of a data address.

schema.description: The name of the data address.

The response body.

Valid values:

*   s:s.

ImportAddress.description:
The details for obtaining the data address.

Valid values:

*   1:1

GetAddress.title: GetAddress

ListAddress.summary: Lists the data addresses created by a user in the specific region.

schema.description:
The marker after which the migration addresses are listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of migration addresses to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000 (excluding 0).\
Default value: 1000.
The response body.

ListAddress.title: ListAddress

schema.description: The name of the data address.
The request body for updating the data address.

ImportAddress.description: The details for updating the data address.

UpdateAddress.title: UpdateAddress
UpdateAddress.description: *   If the data address is associated with an agent, you can scale in or out the agent.

schema.description: The name of the data address.

VerifyAddress.summary: Verifies whether a data address is available.

schema.description: The name of the data address.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response body.

VerifyAddressResponse.description: The details for verifying the data address.

VerifyAddress.title: VerifyAddress
VerifyAddress.description: *   A data address may not be available even if the data address passes the availability verification. The data migration results prevail.

schema.description: The agent name.
The request body for creating the tunnel.

ImportTunnel.description: The details for creating the tunnel.

CreateTunnel.title: CreateTunnel
CreateTunnel.description:
*   When you use an agent to migrate data, the agent must be associated with a tunnel.
*   A tunnel can be associated with multiple agents at the same time. You can throttle the agents that are associated with the agent by setting the bandwidth and the number of requests per second for the tunnel.
CreateTunnel.responseParamsDescription: If the tunnel is created, a tunnel ID is returned in the response header x-oss-import-tunnel-id.

GetTunnel.summary: Obtains the details of a tunnel.

schema.description: The tunnel ID.
The response body.

ImportTunnel.description: The details for obtaining the details of the tunnel.

GetTunnel.title: GetTunnel

schema.description: The tunnel ID.
The request body for updating the tunnel.

ImportTunnel.description: The details for updating the tunnel.

schema.description:
The marker after which tunnels are listed.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

Specifies the number of tunnels to be returned.\
Valid values: 0 - 1000.\
Default value: 1000.
The response body.
The tunnel ID.
